requirements_checklist.label: Is this request for initiation or continuation of therapy with Wegovy™ (semaglutide)?

children.label: Start of therapy
children.outcome: Authorization for Wegovy™ (semaglutide), is expected to be issued for 4 months

children.label: Treatment is being requested for appetite suppression or weight loss
Patient is ≥ 12 years of age
Used as an adjunct to lifestyle modification (e.g., dietary or caloric restriction, exercise, behavioral support, community-based program)
One of the following
Body Mass Index (BMI) ≥ 30 kg/m2 or for pediatric patients a BMI > 95th percentile
BMI ≥ 27 kg/m2 and patient has a weight-related comorbidity (e.g., dyslipidemia, hypertension, type 2 diabetes, sleep apnea)
Continuation of therapy
children.outcome: Authorization for Wegovy™ (semaglutide), is expected to be issued for 12 months

children.label: Weight loss of ≥ 4% of baseline body weight for Wegovy
Continuation of lifestyle modification

requirements_checklist.label: Is this request for starting or continued therapy with Wegovy™ (semaglutide)?

children.label: Initial review criteria
children.outcome: The requested drug, Wegovy™ (semaglutide), is expected to be covered with prior authorization for 3 months

children.label: Prescribed by Endocrinologist or Weight Management Specialist
Patient at least 18 years of age
Baseline BMI 30 kg/m2 or greater with at least one of the following weight-related comorbidities:
Established cardiovascular disease or stroke
Hypertension
Type 2 DM
CKD
CHD
Obstructive sleep apnea
Polycystic ovarian syndrome
Dyslipidemia
Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease
Idiopathic intracranial hypertension
Osteoarthritis in weight-bearing joints
Documented baseline weight
Patient has attempted to lose weight through a KP-approved weight loss program, and will continue these interventions while on Wegovy

Patient has documented intolerance, contraindication or failure to lose and maintain greater than or equal to 5% body weight after a 3-month trial of ALL of the following medications indicated for chronic weight management:
Xenical (orlistat)
Contrave (naltrexone + bupropion)
Qsymia (phentermine + topiramate)
Saxenda (liraglutide)
Wegovy is not being used in combination with another weight loss drug or GLP-1 receptor agonist
Initial prescription is limited to a maximum of 30-day supply with 2 refills
For patients with Type 2 DM and BMI of 30 kg/m2 or greater, must meet both additional criteria below:
Must follow KP National Adult DM Guidelines and CBC step therapy criteria for use of preferred agents for DM control
Documented intolerance, contraindication, or failure to reach goal A1c after at least 6 month trial of Victoza and Ozempic
Continuation of therapy
children.outcome: The requested drug, Wegovy™ (semaglutide), is expected to be covered with prior authorization for 6 months

children.label: Patient continues to meet initial review criteria
Documented weight loss within the previous 3 months of at least 10% from baseline weight

 (e.g., hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, dyslipidemia)", shape=box];     node7 [label="Is there a documentation of the above weight loss?", shape=box];}start -> node1 [label="Starting", weight=1];start -> node5 [label="Continuing", weight=1];node1 -> node2 [label="Yes", weight=1];node1 -> notEligible [label="No", weight=1];node2 -> node3 [label="Yes", weight=1];node2 -> notEligible [label="No", weight=1];node3 -> node4 [label=">=27 and <=29 kg/m^2", weight=1];node3 -> eligible [label=">=30 kg/m^2", weight=1];node3 -> notEligible [label="<27 kg/m^2", weight=1];node4 -> eligible [label="Yes", weight=1];node4 -> notEligible [label="No", weight=1];node5 -> node6 [label="Yes", weight=1];node5 -> notEligible [label="No", weight=1];node6 -> node7 [label=">=5% weight loss
or
Maintained initial 5% weight loss", weight=1];node6 -> notEligible [label="Weight loss criteria not met", weight=1];node7 -> eligible [label="Yes", weight=1];node7 -> notEligible [label="No", weight=1];}

requirements_checklist.label: Is this request for starting or continued therapy with Wegovy™ (semaglutide)?

children.label: Starting therapy
children.outcome: The requested drug, Wegovy™ (semaglutide), is expected to be covered with prior authorization

children.label: The requested drug, Wegovy™ (semaglutide), will be used in conjunction with a reduced-calorie diet and increased physical activity for chronic weight management in an adult.

The patient has participated in a comprehensive weight management program that encourages behavioral modification, a reduced calorie diet, and increased physical activity with continuing follow-up for at least 6 months prior to using drug therapy.
The patient's Body Mass Index (BMI) meets one of the following conditions:
The patient has a BMI greater than or equal to 30 kg/m²
The patient has a BMI greater than or equal to 27 kg/m² AND has at least one weight-related comorbid condition (e.g., hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, or dyslipidemia)
Continuation of therapy
children.outcome: The requested drug, Wegovy™ (semaglutide), is expected to be covered with prior authorization

children.label: The patient has completed at least 3 months of therapy with the requested drug at a stable maintenance dose
The patient has either:
Lost at least 5 percent of baseline body weight
Continued to maintain their initial 5 percent weight loss
Documentation of the above weight loss is provided.

fields.description: Blue Cross Blue Shield Prior Authorization Requirements for Wegovy in the state of Massachusetts

requirements_checklist.label: Is this request for initiation or continuation of therapy with Wegovy™ (semaglutide)?

children.label: Start of therapy
children.outcome: Authorization for Wegovy™ (semaglutide) may be approved for up to 20 weeks

children.label: Members 18 years of age or older
As an adjunct to a reduced-calorie diet and increased physical activity
For chronic weight management in patients
with an initial body mass index (BMI) of ≥ 30 kg/m2 (obese)
≥ 27 kg/m2 (overweight) in the presence of at least one weight-related comorbid condition (e.g., hypertension, dyslipidemia, type 2 diabetes)
Documentation that the member has been and is currently following a dietary and behavior modification program for weight loss
Continuation of therapy
children.outcome: Authorization for Wegovy™ (semaglutide) may be approved for up to an additional 6 months of therapy

children.label: Demonstrate significant weight loss* after initiation of therapy
Adhering to a reduced-calorie diet
Adhering to increased physical activity
Requires documented weight loss
of at least 4% of baseline body weight after the initiation of treatment (first 16 weeks of treatment)
must demonstrate continued weight loss
maintain the plateau weight achieved with diet and exercise treatment
Member must be on the 2.4mg dose

fields.description: Blue Cross Blue Shield Prior Authorization Requirements for Wegovy in the state of North Carolina
fields.insurance_provider: Blue Cross Blue Shield (BCBS) North Carolina

children.label: For patients 18 years or older
children.outcome: Authorization for Wegovy™ (semaglutide), may be approved when all of the criteria are met

children.label: Is this request for initiation or continuation of therapy with Wegovy™ (semaglutide)?
Start of therapy
children.outcome: Initiation of Wegovy™ (semaglutide) may be approved for up to 18 weeks when all of the following criteria are met

children.label: The patient has taken the medication for less than 18 weeks (For new members who meet initial coverage requirements with greater than 18 weeks of therapy, continuation criteria apply)
The patient is 18 years of age or older, and has one of the following
A diagnosis of obesity and a BMI ≥ 30 kg/m2
A diagnosis of obesity and a BMI ≥ 25 kg/m2, and is of South Asian, Southeast Asian, or East Asian descent
A documented BMI ≥ 27 kg/m2 with at least one weight-related comorbidity/risk factor/complication (e.g., diabetes, dyslipidemia, coronary artery disease)
The requested medication will not be used concurrently with another GLP-1 receptor agonist medication
The requested medication will not be used concurrently with insulin
The requested medication will not be used concurrently with another weight loss medication
The provider has addressed the requirement for lifestyle modifications (calorie restrictions and increased activity) while taking the requested medication

The patient was unable to achieve acceptable weight loss through lifestyle modifications (defined as a 1lb per week weight loss through calorie restriction, increased activity, and behavioral modifications in a 6-month period), or has a weight-related comorbidity/risk factor/complication (e.g., diabetes, dyslipidemia, coronary artery disease) that warrants medication interventions immediately
The patient has anti-obesity medication coverage benefits

For formularies that exclude the requested medication, Non-formulary Exception Criteria applies (3 other medications that target the same condition have been tried and they either did not work or were not tolerated.)
Continuation of therapy
children.outcome: Continuation of Wegovy™ (semaglutide) therapy may be approved for up to an additional 365 days (1 year) when all of the criteria are met

children.label: The patient was approved through Blue Cross NC initial coverage criteria, or is new to the plan, meets the initial coverage requirements listed above, and has taken the medication greater than 18 weeks
The patient is 18 years of age or older and has achieved and maintained a weight loss of ≥4% from baseline (prior to the initiation of requested medication)
The patient has anti-obesity medication coverage benefits
For patients aged 12 to 17 years
children.outcome: Authorization for Wegovy™ (semaglutide), may be approved when all of the criteria are met

children.label: Is this request for initiation or continuation of therapy with Wegovy™ (semaglutide)?
Start of therapy
children.outcome: Initiation of Wegovy™ (semaglutide) may be approved for up to 18 weeks when all of the following criteria are met

children.label: The patient has taken the medication for less than 18 weeks (For new members who meet initial coverage requirements with greater than 18 weeks of therapy, continuation criteria apply)
The patient is 12–17 years of age and the request is for Wegovy (semaglutide), with a diagnosis of obesity and a BMI > 95th percentile for age and sex
The requested medication will not be used concurrently with another GLP-1 receptor agonist medication
The requested medication will not be used concurrently with insulin
The requested medication will not be used concurrently with another weight loss medication
The provider has addressed the requirement for lifestyle modifications (calorie restrictions and increased activity) while taking the requested medication

The patient was unable to achieve acceptable weight loss through lifestyle modifications (defined as a 1lb per week weight loss through calorie restriction, increased activity, and behavioral modifications in a 6-month period), or has a weight-related comorbidity/risk factor/complication (e.g., diabetes, dyslipidemia, coronary artery disease) that warrants medication interventions immediately
The patient has anti-obesity medication coverage benefits

For formularies that exclude the requested medication, Non-formulary Exception Criteria applies (3 other medications that target the same condition have been tried and they either did not work or were not tolerated.)
Continuation of therapy
children.outcome: Continuation of Wegovy™ (semaglutide) therapy may be approved for up to an additional 365 days (1 year) when all of the criteria are met

children.label: The patient was approved through Blue Cross NC initial coverage criteria, or is new to the plan, meets the initial coverage requirements listed above, and has taken the medication greater than 18 weeks
The patient is 12–17 years of age and the request is for Wegovy (semaglutide), and has achieved and maintained a BMI reduction of ≥ 5% from baseline (prior to the initiation of requested medication)
The patient has anti-obesity medication coverage benefits

fields.insurance_coverage_state: Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington, West Virginia, Wisconsin, Wyoming

children.label: For patients 18 years or older
children.outcome: Authorization for Wegovy™ (semaglutide), may be approved when all of the criteria are met

children.label: Is this request for initiation or continuation of therapy with Wegovy™ (semaglutide)?
Start of therapy for weight management
children.outcome: Initiation of Wegovy™ (semaglutide) may be approved for up to 16 weeks when all of the following criteria are met

children.label: Member meets one of the following:
BMI ≥ 30 kg/m2

BMI ≥ 27 kg/m2 with at least one indicator of increased cardiovascular risk (e.g., coronary artery/heart disease, hypertension, dyslipidemia, diabetes, elevated waist circumference) or other obesity-related medical condition (e.g., sleep apnea)
Age ≥ 18 years
Wegovy is not prescribed concurrently with other semaglutide-containing products or any other GLP-1 receptor agonist(s)
Documentation that member is actively enrolled in a weight loss program that involves a reduced calorie diet and increased physical activity adjunct to therapy
Dose does not exceed the following:
Week 1 through 4: 0.25 mg once weekly
Week 5 through 8: 0.5 mg once weekly
Week 9 through 12: 1 mg once weekly
Week 13 through 16: 1.7 mg once weekly
Continuation of therapy
children.outcome: Continuation of Wegovy™ (semaglutide) therapy may be approved for up to an additional 365 days (1 year) when all of the criteria are met

children.label: Member meets one of the following:
Currently receiving medication via Centene benefit or member has previously met initial approval criteria
Member is currently receiving medication and is enrolled in a state and product with continuity of care regulations
Member is responding positively to therapy as evidenced by one of the following:
If this is the first renewal request, member has lost ≥ 5% of baseline body weight (adults)
If this is a second or subsequent renewal request, member has lost weight and/or maintained weight loss on therapy
Wegovy is not prescribed concurrently with other semaglutide-containing products or any other GLP-1 receptor agonist(s)
Documentation that member is actively enrolled in a weight loss program that involves a reduced calorie diet and increased physical activity adjunct to therapy
Request meets both of the following:
Dose does not exceed 2.4 mg once weekly
After the initial dose escalation period, one of the following:
Maintenance dose is 2.4 mg
A temporary dose reduction to 1.7 mg is needed for a maximum of 4 weeks
For patients aged 12 to 17 years

Use with other weight loss medications. Use with other medications intended for weight loss is not recommended

fields.description: Molina Prior Authorization Requirements for Wegovy

requirements_checklist.label: Is this request for initiation or continuation of therapy with Wegovy™ (semaglutide)?

children.label: Start of therapy
children.outcome: Initial Authorization for Wegovy™ (semaglutide) may be granted for 6 months when the criteria are met

children.label: Body mass index (BMI) requirements:
BMI ≥ 30, if no applicable risk factors
BMI ≥ 27 with two or more of the following risk factors: coronary heart disease, dyslipidemia, hypertension, sleep apnea, type II diabetes
Body weight above 60 kg and an initial BMI corresponding to 30 kg/m2 for adults (obese) by international cut-offs
Wegovy is only covered for members 18 years of age or older
No contraindications to use
No malabsorption syndromes, cholestasis, pregnancy, and/or lactation
No history of an eating disorder (e.g., anorexia, bulimia)

Previous failure of a weight loss treatment plan (e.g., nutritional counseling, an exercise regimen and a calorie/fat-restricted diet) in the past 6 months and will continue to follow as part of the treatment plan
Documentation of current medical status including nutritional or dietetic assessment
Documentation of current therapy for all medical conditions (including obesity), identifying specific treatments including medications
Current accurate height and weight measurements
No medical contraindications to use a reversible lipase inhibitor (Xenical®)
Current weight loss plan or program including diet and exercise plan
No chronic opioid use concurrently with Contrave®
Member is not concurrently on Victoza or Ozempic or other GLP-1 inhibitors
Continuation of therapy
children.outcome: Reauthorization for Wegovy™ (semaglutide) may be granted for an additional 6-month SA when the criteria are met

children.label: The member has achieved a weight loss of at least 5% of baseline weight
The member’s BMI is > 24
